title: Keeping interest rates low through ‘Quack Economics’ has forced investors out of savings accounts
text: Dear John: The idea that quantitative easing (QE), along with the Federal Reserve’s zero-interest-rate policy, hasn’t created inflation is false.  While the prices of things like TVs and clothing has remained muted, things like housing, health care and education have continued to skyrocket.

title: China's central bank chief says trade tensions major risk to global economy
text: China's top central banker said on Saturday that potential escalation of trade tensions and policy uncertainty were the major risk factors facing the world economy, and market forces were keeping China's yuan at an appropriate level.

title: Fallout from Trump's trade wars felt by economies around the world
text: The collateral damage of the United States' trade wars is being felt from the fjords of Iceland to the auto factories of Japan.

title: My Bloomberg Interview and Analysis of the Global Stock Markets
text: Needless to say, I was pretty darn excited about appearing on Bloomberg TV! Ahead of the interview, they sent me a list of potential topics for me to respond to.

title: Not all recessions are a crisis, and the next one won't be as bad as 2008
text: Recession fears are on the rise in the United States. Memories of the last downturn are exacerbating these worries: The last time America faced a recession was in 2008, as the financial crisis was unfolding.

title: Is There A Secret Weapon In The Trade War?

title: The US and China made 'substantial progress' at trade talks, Chinese vice premier says
text: "The two sides have made substantial progress in many fields, laying an important foundation for the signing of a phased agreement," Chinese Vice Premier Liu He said on Saturday.
